p: Nitrate, a common oxidant in explosives, can be prone to explosion when it comes in contact with most organic substances. The presence of nitrate is a potential threat to public safety. The detection of nitrate can be equivalent to the detection of nitrate ion. As nitrate ions cannot be directly adsorbed on the surface of the substrate, the substrate modified with DDTC was used again to accumulate nitrate ion in swabbing extraction [ 12]. In this experiment, the trace amount of potassium nitrate on the clean aluminum sheet was collect by wiping and extracting for SERS detection. Figure 7c is the SERS spectra of potassium nitrate (normalized by the Raman peak at 1271 cm âˆ’1 of DDTC). The conventional Raman spectrum of potassium nitrate is shown in Figure S11c for comparison. The characteristic peak intensity of nitrate is proportional to the content of it. As illustrated in Figure S9f, the linear equation was computed, and the dynamic range is from 0.0110 to 1.10 ng. Moreover, the LOD of the fluoranthene mass was calculated to be 0.0273 ng.
